TopicTitle: Where to post my crash report?

Articles.Content:
Hi all,

I've got a simple question. My KSP has crashed to desktop and generated a report. The problem is that I'm not sure whether the crash is caused by a mod or by KSP itself. Browsing through the content of the report doesn't help me to decide where to post it, in the official- or in the addon bug thread. What's the best thing to do?
Remove all mods and try to get the crash to happen again. If it does then you can report it as a crash report. Since 0.21 they no longer support modded games.

Remove all mods and try to get the crash to happen again. If it does then you can report it as a crash report. Since 0.21 they no longer support modded games.

I can't do that. All my ships use modded parts. If I remove all mods, none of the ships will load. Or do you suggest starting a whole clean KSP version, discarding all my progress, rebuilding all my rockets and re-create my whole space program!? That would take days, if not more.

Is there a way for myself to find out what causes the crash?

We don't support modded ksp version, since the crash can happen due to the mod and not the stock.

All the resource you need are in the support & bug forum

You want to read all the sticky posts, mainly:

Self-help for crashes - look here first if KSP crashes

NEED SUPPORT? Read this before posting

Bug Reporting Guidelines / Bug Tracker

Starting with 0.21: Warranty void for modded installations

If you don't want to remove your mod to try to reproduce the crash, you can try to ask for support on the addon support forum.

For some crash, also, using the research of the forum, can help yo find the cause.
